snippet: Everyone starting the school day with a nutritious meal would remove any stigma of a free breakfast and would ensure that no child is learning on an empty stomach.
abstract: Editorial calls on New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio to make good on promise to require all public schools to serve free breakfasts in the classroom; argues there is no good reason for New York to have fallen behind cities like Los Angeles and Newark in introducing a program with such clearly-demonstrated health benefits.
lead_paragraph: Everyone starting the school day with a nutritious meal would remove any stigma of a free breakfast and would ensure that no child is learning on an empty stomach.

headline.main: Classroom Breakfasts: a Good Idea, Overdue
